page.title: 01Tiverton A General Account
page.content: The main town in our area is Tiverton. It has a population of about 16,000. It stands at the point where the River Exe meets the River Lowman. It has got several Factories but it is not really very industrial. In the middle of the town there is the Market Place. There are several parks in the town and it is surrounded by hills and open countryside. Some of us still think that the town is smelly compared with the country! There are many council houses. These are on estates around the edges of the town. Most of the shops and older buildings (eg the Castle and St Peter's Church) are in the centre of the town. A new Link Road joins the town to the M5 Motorway in the East but to the West the roads are much smaller. They run through land used mainly for beef, dairy and sheep farming.
